subtitleNullable: AV : Timeseries WOMart Sales Forecasting Jobathon Sep21
descriptionNullable:
About Time Series :
Time Series forecasting & modelling plays an important role in data analysis. Time series analysis is a specialized branch of statistics used extensively in fields such as Econometrics & Operation Research.
Time Series is being widely used in analytics & data science. This is specifically designed time series problem for you and challenge is to forecast sales.

Problem Statement :
Your Client WOMart is a leading nutrition and supplement retail chain that offers a comprehensive range of products for all your wellness and fitness needs. 
WOMart follows a multi-channel distribution strategy with 350+ retail stores spread across 100+ cities. 
Effective forecasting for store sales gives essential insight into upcoming cash flow, meaning WOMart can more accurately plan the cashflow at the store level.
Sales data for 18 months from 365 stores of WOMart is available along with information on Store Type, Location Type for each store, Region Code for every store, Discount provided by the store on every day, Number of Orders everyday etc.

Data Description
Train Set
Train.csv – File containing features related to Store Type, Location Type for each store, Region Code for every store, Discount provided by the store on every day, Number of Orders, Sales everyday 
Test Set
Test.csv – File containing features related to Store Type, Location Type for each store, Region Code for every store, Discount provided by the store on every day, Number of Orders everyday . Need to predict the Store Sales for each Store for next two months.
Sample Submission:
ID: Unique id  Sales: Total Sale for the Store on the given Day w.r.t each id in test data

Evaluation Metric:
The evaluation metric for this competition is MSLE * 1000 across all entries in the test set.

Acknowledgements
More details can be found on Analytics Vidhya website who conducted the hackathon.
https://datahack.analyticsvidhya.com/contest/job-a-thon-september-2021/#ProblemStatement
